answer_html: It can be assumed that \(\displaystyle \lambda _1 = 1\) is the first entry in D, the corresponding eigenvector is the first column of matrix V.To get the ranking we scale so that the sum is equal to 1.>> V(:,1) / sum(V(:,1))
answer_latex:
It can be assumed that $\displaystyle \lambda _1 = 1$ is the first entry
in \emph{D}, the corresponding eigenvector is the first column of matrix
\emph{V}.To get the ranking we scale so that the sum is equal to 1.\textgreater{}\textgreater{} V(:,1) / sum(V(:,1))
question: Section 201 06 (d)
sols_html:
>> [V D] = eig(S)

Where V is the matrix of normalized eigenvectors, and D is the diagonal matrix of eigenvalues.

It can be assumed that \(\displaystyle \lambda _1 = 1\) is the first entry in D, the corresponding eigenvector is the first column of matrix V. To get the ranking we scale so that the sum is equal to 1.

>> V(:,1) / sum(V(:,1))
sols_latex:
\textgreater{}\textgreater{} {[}V D{]} = eig(S)

Where \emph{V} is the matrix of normalized eigenvectors, and \emph{D} is
the diagonal matrix of eigenvalues.

It can be assumed that $\displaystyle \lambda _1 = 1$ is the first entry
in \emph{D}, the corresponding eigenvector is the first column of matrix
\emph{V}. To get the ranking we scale so that the sum is equal to 1.

\textgreater{}\textgreater{} V(:,1) / sum(V(:,1))
sols_raw:
>> [V D] = eig(S)

Where ''V'' is the matrix of normalized eigenvectors, and ''D'' is the diagonal matrix of eigenvalues. 

It can be assumed that <math> \displaystyle \lambda _1 = 1 </math> is the first entry in ''D'', the corresponding eigenvector is the first column of matrix ''V''. To get the ranking we scale so that the sum is equal to 1.

>> V(:,1) / sum(V(:,1))
statement_html:
Consider the same graph as in the previous question, now interpreted as an internet where the vertices represent web pages and the arrows represent links.

(d) Write down the MATLAB/Octave code that would compute the ranking for each page using the eig command.

statement_raw:
Consider the same graph as in the [[Science:Math_Exam_Resources/Courses/MATH307/April_2013/Question_Section_201_05_(a)|previous question]], now interpreted as an internet where the vertices represent web pages and the arrows represent links.

:[[File:MATH307April2013Section201Q6.png|300px]]

'''(d)''' Write down the MATLAB/Octave code that would compute the ranking for each page using the '''eig''' command.
